I learned a lot from field trips.

I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I thoroughly enjoyed the group discussions, not only on the readings, but on the individual presentations during the final weeks. We all benefited from the information provided and the multiple perspectives shared.

The small class size was great for discussions. And it was great to have visiting professionals and students. David Mattson's lectures were outstanding and the Skype conversation with NRCC leaders were insightful as well.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Perhaps a clearer understanding the functioning of a variety of conservation NGO's that are truly achieving the goals set out in their strategic action plans. How do the plans bring the vision statement to life? How do they successfully adapt over time?

I thought the course could have been organized better. Some weeks it seemed that we rehashed the same material. The course was supposed to focus on non-profit organizations but in reality it was tangential to the course material we covered. The students did make some recommendations midway through the semester about how the course could be improved but I am not sure that it was accomplished.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course helped me to clarify and strengthen my standpoint on the conservation issues that I am managing on a daily basis and also encouraged me to continueto enhance the strengths that I already exhibit when dealing with the public.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to gain a better understanding of the complexity of society's view on conservation issues and how some organizations have been more successful than others in bridging the disconnect between stakeholders.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Many of the readings were incredibly beneficial for my long term use with evolving local organization that I am working with to establish strategic action plans. The course itself, very surprisingly, took me in a different direction entirely by allowing me to delve deeper into my personal standpoint on multiple conservation issues and why I choose the directions that I am taking in my career and in my life. The class was very beneficial for me in providing a roadmap for future development of my skills, and especially for encouraging patience, understanding, and longer term evaluation of issues using interdisciplinary techniques that will better insure lasting positive impact and support from stakeholders.
I wish the nonprofit focus for the semester had been more central to the course.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We worked as a group taking different chapters in Plato's Revenge. It was a very

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This course and the readings will be very helpful if the student plans to be involved in land use decision making at any scale. Understanding how to deal with the public and respecting a variety of view points is critical to the success of long term, lasting decisions. The course also provided a good perspective on the design and function of of a sampling of conservation NGO's.
